intro: Antura hadiensis, commonly known as the Hadiensis antur, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow to orange flower heads that are surrounded by pale green ray florets. Antura hadiensis typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable climates.
